column5: J Hennecke; A Carfi; D C Wiley
column8: Structure of a covalently stabilized complex of a human alphabeta T-cell receptor, influenza HA peptide and MHC class II molecule, HLA-DR1.
column43: Exposure with existing immune reactivity without evidence for disease
column98: Generation of the T Cell clone HA1.7 was previously described in the cited reference: Lamb et al. (1982) Nature 300: 66-69 [PMID: 6982419]. PBL from adult volunteers selected for known responses to Influenza A virus (A/Texas/1/1977(H3N2)) were cultured with HA isolated from this subtype. After 6 days, cultures were cloned by limiting dilution and screened for reactivity to generate the a T cell clone (HA1.7) specific for the epitope. The HA1.7 TCR alpha and ß chain ectodomains were cloned and expressed. The ß chain construct encodes a fusion protein with the epitope linked to the N-terminus via a peptide linker GGSGGGGG.
column99: Figures 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, Table III and PDB 1FYT
column140: The crystal structure of the HA1.7 TCR bound to the epitope/HLA-DR1 complex was determined by molecular replacement.

column5: E L Reinherz; K Tan; L Tang; P Kern; J Liu; Y Xiong; R E Hussey; A Smolyar; B Hare; R Zhang; A Joachimiak; H C Chang; G Wagner; J Wang
column8: The crystal structure of a T cell receptor in complex with peptide and MHC class II.
column16: Ovotransferrin precursor (Conalbumin) (Serum transferrin) (Allergen Gal d 3) (Allergen Gal d III)
column23: The first three epitope residues come from the leader sequence and the rest 13 from conalbumin peptide.
column49: Ovotransferrin precursor (Conalbumin) (Serum transferrin) (Allergen Gal d 3) (Allergen Gal d III)
column86: Ovotransferrin precursor (Conalbumin) (Serum transferrin) (Allergen Gal d 3) (Allergen Gal d III)
column98: The D10 TCR was derived from the conalbumin-specific T cell clone D10.G4. Generation of the T Cell clone was previously described in the reference cited: Kaye et al. (1983) J Exp Med. 158(3):836-856 [PMID: 6193236]. Draining lymph nodes were removed 6 days after immunization with ovalbumin contaminated with conalbumin and T cells were restimulated in vitro with the same antigen and cloned by limiting dilution.
column99: Table 1, Figures 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and PDB 1D9K
column132: Ovotransferrin precursor (Conalbumin) (Serum transferrin) (Allergen Gal d 3) (Allergen Gal d III)
column140: The crystal structure contains the MHC/epitope complex bound to V module of TCR D10, derived from AKR/J (H-2k) mouse T cell clone D10.G4. There are two complexes in the crystallographic asymmetric unit, related to each other by a 115 degree rotation. PDB chains for each complex are: Complex I: MHC alpha-chain: C, MHC beta-chain: D, epitope chain: P, TCR alpha-chain: A,  TCR beta-chain: B; Complex II: MHC alpha-chain: G, MHC beta-chain: H, epitope chain: Q, TCR alpha-chain: E,  TCR beta-chain: F. The two complexes are very similar and only complex I is discussed in the analysis. The final model includes residues 1-182 and 2-190 of MHC alpha and beta chains, respectively, all 16 epitope residues and residues 2-117, 3-116 of TCR Valpha and Vbeta domains, respectively.

column5: Jennifer Maynard; Karin Petersson; Dianne H Wilson; Erin J Adams; Sylvie E Blondelle; Marty J Boulanger; Darcy B Wilson; K Christopher Garcia
column8: Structure of an autoimmune T cell receptor complexed with class II peptide-MHC: insights into MHC bias and antigen specificity.
column23: The first three epitope residues remain from the leader peptide of the myelin basic protein. The N-terminal acetylation, required for MHC binding, is mimicked by a G residue (fourth residue) before the first MBP residue.
column25: Fragment of a Natural Sequence Molecule
column98: Generation of T cell hybridoma clone 172.10 was previously described in the reference cited Urban et al. (1988) Cell 54: 577-592 [PMID: 2456857]. Draining popliteal, inguinal, and paraaortic lymph nodes were removed 10 days after immunization and stimulated in vitro with MBP. MBP-reactive helper T cell blasts were fused with BW5147 thymoma cells and cloned. The 172.10 TCR was cloned and expressed as a single-chain Fv (scTCR).
column99: Figures 1, 2, 3, 4 and Supplementary Tables S1 and S2 and PDB 1U3H
column140: Epitope-specific 172.10 TCR single-chain Fv complexed to I-Au-epitope was crystallized. There are two molecules in the crystallographic asymmetric unit. PDB chains for each complex are: Complex I: MHC alpha-chain: C, MHC beta-chain: D, epitope chain: P, TCR alpha-chain: A, TCR beta-chain: B. Complex II: MHC alpha-chain: G, MHC beta-chain: H, epitope chain: I, TCR alpha-chain: E, TCR beta-chain: F.The final model includes TCR residues: alpha chain 2-116 and beta chain 3-117, MHC residues: alpha chain 1-181 and beta chain 1-190 and all epitope residues.

column5: Lu Deng; Ries J Langley; Patrick H Brown; Gang Xu; Leslie Teng; Qian Wang; Monica I Gonzales; Glenda G Callender; Michael I Nishimura; Suzanne L Topalian; Roy A Mariuzza
column8: Structural basis for the recognition of mutant self by a tumor-specific, MHC class II-restricted T cell receptor.
column98: The E8 TCR was derived from a CD4+ T cell clone generated from tumor infiltrating lymphocytes from a subcutaneous metastatic melanoma lesion as described in the cited reference: Pieper et al. (1999) J Exp Med 189: 757-765 [PMID: 10049939].
column99: Table 1, Supplementary Table 1, Figures 4, 5, 6 and PDB 2IAN
column140: The crystal structure of epitope/HLA-DR1 in complex with the E8 TCR was determined by molecular replacement. To stabilize the complex for crystallization, the peptide was covalently attached to the TCR beta-chain by an octapeptide linker. There are four complexes in the crystallographic asymmetric unit. PDB chains for each complex are: Complex I: MHC alpha-chain: A, MHC beta-chain: B, epitope chain: C, TCR alpha-chain: D, TCR beta-chain: E. Complex II: MHC alpha-chain: F, MHC beta-chain: G, epitope chain: H, TCR alpha-chain: I, TCR beta-chain: J. Complex III: MHC alpha-chain: K, MHC beta-chain: L, epitope chain: M, TCR alpha-chain: N, TCR beta-chain: O. Complex IV: MHC alpha-chain: P, MHC beta-chain: Q, epitope chain: R, TCR alpha-chain: S, TCR beta-chain: T. All epitope residues had clear electron density.

column5: Shaodong Dai; Eric S Huseby; Kira Rubtsova; James Scott-Browne; Frances Crawford; Whitney A Macdonald; Philippa Marrack; John W Kappler
column8: Crossreactive T Cells spotlight the germline rules for alphabeta T cell-receptor interactions with MHC molecules.
column23: Epitope is an immunogenic variant of an Ealpha-derived peptide (pEalpha), with three mutations: G5 -> K5, L7 -> K7, I10 -> K10. The epitope binds to I-Ab as stably as pEalpha.
column25: Fragment of a Natural Sequence Molecule
column31: H-2 class II histocompatibility antigen, E-U alpha chain
column33: H-2 class II histocompatibility antigen, E-U alpha chain
column98: The B3K506 TCR was cloned from a T Cell hybridoma generated as previously described in the reference cited: Huseby et al. (1999) Cell 122: 274-260 [PMID: 16051149]. Mice were immunized with dendritic cells presenting IAb covalently bound to the epitope, 3K. The responding IAb + 3K-reactive T cells were converted into T hybridomas.
column99: Figures 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, S3, Tables 1, S1 and PDB 3C5Z
column140: The crystal structure of TCR B3K506 bound to the epitope/I-Ab complex was determined. The epitope is covalently linked to the N-terminus of the MHC beta-chain, via a flexible peptide linker. The crystallographic asymmetric unit contains two complexes. PDB chains for each complex are: Complex I: MHC alpha-chain: C, MHC beta-chain/epitope chain: D, TCR alpha-chain: A, TCR beta-chain: B. Complex II: MHC alpha-chain: G, MHC beta-chain/epitope chain: H, TCR alpha-chain: E, TCR beta-chain: F. For analysis, one of the two complexes was chosen, on the basis of the fewest V region crystal contacts. The complex with extensive V region crystal contacts had clearly distorted the TCR-MHC interface.

column98: The J809.B5 TCR was previously described in the cited reference: Stadinski et al. (2011) Immunity 35: 694-704 [PMID: 22101158]. Mice genetically manipulated to express I-Ab bearing just a single peptide (IAb-SP mice) were immunized with dendritic cells presenting IAb covalently bound to the epitope, 3K. The responding IAb + 3K-reactive T cells were converted into T hybridomas, including YAe62 as described in the cited reference: Huseby et al. (2005) Cell 122: 274-260 [PMID: 16051149].  Mice expressing the Vbeta8.2 YAe62 TCR beta chain as a transgene were generated and bred onto MHC wild type mice. Mice were infected with Vac:IAb-3K and responding CD4+ T cells were isolated by positive selection using antibody affinity columns and converted into hybridomas to generate the J809.B5 hybridoma. The J809.B5 TCR was cloned and expressed.
column99: Figure 2, Supplemental Figure 2, Table II and PDB 4P23
column140: The crystal structure of the J809.B5 TCR bound to the epitope/I-Ab complex was solved by molecular replacement. The epitope is covalently linked to the N-terminus of the I-Ab ß chain via a linker peptide. There is one TCR and one MHC per asymmetric unit.

Mice genetically manipulated to express I-Ab bearing just a single peptide (IAb-SP mice) were immunized with dendritic cells presenting IAb covalently bound to the epitope, 3K. The responding IAb + 3K-reactive T cells were converted into T hybridomas, including YAe62. Mice expressing the Vbeta8.2 YAe62 TCR beta chain as a transgene were generated and bred onto MHC wild type mice. column98: Generation of the T cell clone 5C.C7 was originally described in the reference: Fink et al. (1986) Nature 321: 219-226 [PMID: 3012351]. Mice were immunized with pigeon cytochrome c (PCC) and LN cells were restimulated in vitro and cloned by limiting dilution.
column99: Table S1, Figure 5 and PDB 4P2R
column140: The crystal structure of the 5CC7 TCR bound to the peptide/H-2-IEk complex was solved by molecular replacement. The peptide was expressed fused to the N-terminus of the TCR beta chain with a 10-residue flexible GlySer linker. There are four complexes in the asymmetric unit.

column8: Structural basis of chronic beryllium disease: linking allergic hypersensitivity and autoimmunity.
column98: Generation of the T cell hybridomas was previously described in the cited reference: Bowerman et al (2011) J Immunol 187: 3694-3703 [PMID: 21873524]. Be-induced T cell lines and clones were established from lung of a chronic beryllium disease (CBD) patient. The AV22 TCR was cloned and expressed in insect cells.
column99: Figures 3, 4, 5, 6, Tables 1, S1, S2 and PDB 4P4K
column140: The crystal structure of the epitope-Be/HLA-DP2 complex bound by the AV22 TCR was determined. The epitope was expressed within the peptide QAFWIDLFETIGGGSLVPRGSGGGGS covalently linked to the N-terminus of the HLA-DP ß chain.

column5: Dhruv K Sethi; Susana Gordo; David A Schubert; Kai W Wucherpfennig
column8: Crossreactivity of a human autoimmune TCR is dominated by a single TCR loop.
column98: Generation of the T Cell clone Hy.1B11 was previously described in the cited reference: Wucherpfennig et al. (1994) J Exp Med 179: 279–290 [PMID: 7505801]. T cell clones from relapsing-remitting MS patients were generated by 2 rounds of stimulation with MBP, then stimulated with the MBP(84-102) peptide (DENPVVHFFKNIVTPRTPP), followed by limiting dilution.
column99: Figures 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, Table 1, Supplementary Figure S1, Supplementary Tables S1, S2 and PDB 4GRL
column140: The crystal structure of the epitope bound to HLA-DQ1 (HLA-DQA1*01:02/DQB1*05:02) in complex with the Hy.1B11 TCR was determined. The epitope was attached to the N-terminus of the Hy.1B11 TCRbeta chain through a flexible octapeptide linker (GGSGGGGG). Residues MK were added at the N-terminus of the epitope. The asymmetric unit contained one MHC-peptide-TCR molecule.

column5: Jan Petersen; Jeroen van Bergen; Khai Lee Loh; Yvonne Kooy-Winkelaar; Dennis X Beringer; Allan Thompson; Sjoerd F Bakker; Chris J J Mulder; Kristin Ladell; James E McLaren; David A Price; Jamie Rossjohn; Hugh H Reid; Frits Koning
column8: Determinants of gliadin-specific T cell selection in celiac disease.
column25: Fragment of a Natural Sequence Molecule
column98: Small intestine biopsy samples were obtained from four adult HLA-DQ8+ CD patients on a gluten-free diet. Collagenase-released lymphocytes were stimulated in vitro with a deamidated gliadin preparation and expanded for 4–11 d before labeling with epitope/HLA-DQ8 tetramers. Tetramer+ CD4+ T cells were sorted and cloned to obtain epitope(DQ8-glia-alpha1)-specific T cell clones.
column99: Figures 4, 5, Table III, Supplemental Table 2 and PDB 4Z7V
column140: The crystal structure of the HLA-DQ8-glia-alpha1–specific TCR L3-L2 bound to the epitope/HLA-DQ8 complex was determined.

column5: Dennis X Beringer; Fleur S Kleijwegt; Florian Wiede; Arno R van der Slik; Khai Lee Loh; Jan Petersen; Nadine L Dudek; Gaby Duinkerken; Sandra Laban; Antoinette Joosten; Julian P Vivian; Zhenjun Chen; Adam P Uldrich; Dale I Godfrey; James McCluskey; David A Price; Kristen J Radford; Anthony W Purcell; Tatjana Nikolic; Hugh H Reid; Tony Tiganis; Bart O Roep; Jamie Rossjohn
column8: T cell receptor reversed polarity recognition of a self-antigen major histocompatibility complex.
column98: Proinsulin C19-A3 (epitope)–specific lines were induced from isolated naive CD4+ T cells by a two-round stimulation with autologous proinsulin C19-A3–pulsed DCs (tDCs for Treg, mDCs for Teff). Naive CD4+ cells were isolated by negative selection, and plated with activated, epitope-pulsed DC in a 1:10 ratio for three days. T cells were thereafter left to rest for three days in culture medium supplemented with 10 ng/ml IL-7 and 5 ng/ml IL-15 and subsequently re-stimulated with activated, epitope-pulsed DCs for four days. The iTreg clones were generated by limiting dilution cloning from a proinsulin C19-A3–specific Treg line. TCR alpha and beta chains were cloned, expressed in bacteria and purified.
column99: Table 1, Figure 2, Supplementary Figures 3, 4, 5, Supplementary Table 2 and PDB 4Y19
column140: The crystal structure of the FS18 TCR bound to the HLA-DR-B1*0401/epitope complex was determined.

column5: Jan Petersen; Yvonne Kooy-Winkelaar; Khai Lee Loh; Mai Tran; Jeroen van Bergen; Frits Koning; Jamie Rossjohn; Hugh H Reid
column8: Diverse T Cell Receptor Gene Usage in HLA-DQ8-Associated Celiac Disease Converges into a Consensus Binding Solution.
column25: Fragment of a Natural Sequence Molecule
column98: Generation of the T Cell clone was previously described in the cited reference: Petersen et al. (2015) J Immunol 194(12): 6112-6122. doi: 10.4049/jimmunol.1500161. [PMID: 25948817]. The T cell clone Bel502 was established from a small intestinal biopsy obtained from CD patient who carried the HLA-type HLA-DQA1*03/03-DQB1*0301/0302 and were HLA-DQ8+. The duodenal biopsy was cultured with a TG2-treated gluten digest for 5 d and expanded with IL-2 and IL-15. Cells were stained with HLA-DQ8/glia-alpha1 tetramers and tetramer+ CD4+ T cells were isolated and cloned. The Bel502 TCR was cloned and expressed.
column99: Figures 2, 3, Table 2 and PDB 5KS9
column140: The crystal structure of the epitope/HLA-DQ8 complex bound to the Bel502 TCR was determined.

column5: Jan Petersen; Yvonne Kooy-Winkelaar; Khai Lee Loh; Mai Tran; Jeroen van Bergen; Frits Koning; Jamie Rossjohn; Hugh H Reid
column8: Diverse T Cell Receptor Gene Usage in HLA-DQ8-Associated Celiac Disease Converges into a Consensus Binding Solution.
column25: Fragment of a Natural Sequence Molecule
column98: Generation of the T Cell clone was previously described in the cited reference: Petersen et al. (2015) J Immunol 194(12): 6112-6122. doi: 10.4049/jimmunol.1500161. [PMID: 25948817]. The T cell clone Bel602 was established from a small intestinal biopsy obtained from CD patient who carried the HLA-type HLA-DQA1*03/03-DQB1*0301/0302 and were HLA-DQ8+. The duodenal biopsy was cultured with a TG2-treated gluten digest for 5 d and expanded with IL-2 and IL-15. Cells were stained with HLA-DQ8/glia-alpha1 tetramers and tetramer+ CD4+ T cells were isolated and cloned. The Bel602 TCR was cloned and expressed.
column99: Figure 2, 4, Table 2 and PDB 5KSA
column140: The crystal structure of the epitope/HLA-DQ8.5 complex bound to the Bel602 TCR was determined.

column5: Jan Petersen; Yvonne Kooy-Winkelaar; Khai Lee Loh; Mai Tran; Jeroen van Bergen; Frits Koning; Jamie Rossjohn; Hugh H Reid
column8: Diverse T Cell Receptor Gene Usage in HLA-DQ8-Associated Celiac Disease Converges into a Consensus Binding Solution.
column25: Fragment of a Natural Sequence Molecule
column98: Generation of the T Cell clone was previously described in the cited reference: Kooy-Winkelaar et al. (2011) J Immunol 187(10): 5123-5129. doi: 10.4049/jimmunol.1101179. [PMID: 22013116]. The T cell clone T15 was established from a small intestinal biopsy obtained from CD patient who carried the unusual HLA-type HLA-DQA1*0501/*0401 and HLA-DQB1*0302/*0402 and expresses HLA-DQ8trans (HLA-DQA1*05 (HLA-DQ2alpha) and HLA-DQB1*0302 (HLA-DQ8beta)). The duodenal biopsy was cultured with a mixture of gluten and TG2-treated gluten for 5 d. Subsequently, IL-2 and IL-15 were added to expand the T cells and gluten-reactive T cells were cloned by limiting dilution. Clone T15 responded to stimulation with the gamma-gliadin–derived peptide QQPQQSFPEQERP. The T15 TCR was cloned and expressed.
column99: Figures 2, 5, Table 2 and PDB 5KSB
column140: The crystal structure of the epitope/HLA-DQ8.5 complex bound to the T15 TCR was determined.
